title: Representations of Trig Function - Unit Circle

content.description:
There is a note that the figure is not drawn to scale. Neither axis shows tick marks or a scale.

The circle is centered at the origin.

Point P is on the circle with coordinates (5 comma 0).

A radius is shown from the origin to the point Q in the first quadrant.

The angle formed by the radius and the positive x axis is labeled theta.

A dashed vertical line is shown from point Q down to the x axis with a right angle symbol at the point where it meets the x axis.

A dashed horizontal line is shown from point Q and to the left to the y axis with a right angle symbol at the point where it meets the y axis.

The vertical dashed line is longer than the horizontal dashed line.

The figure shows a circle centered at the origin with an angle of measure <math alttext="theta"><mi>θ</mi></math> radians in standard position and point <math alttext="P"> <mi>P</mi> </math> on the circle. The terminal ray of the angle intersects the circle at point <math alttext="Q"><mi>Q</mi></math>. The length of arc <math alttext="arc P Q"><mover><mrow><mi>P</mi><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mo>⏜</mo></mover></math> is <math alttext="6"><mn>6</mn></math> units.
content.question: Which of the following gives the distance of point <math alttext="Q"><mi>Q</mi></math> from the <math alttext="y"> <mi>y</mi> </math>-axis?

choices.label: <math alttext="5 cos open parentheses 6 over 5 close parentheses"><mn>5</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mn>6</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac></mfenced></math>
<math alttext="5 sin open parentheses 6 over 5 close parentheses"><mn>5</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mn>6</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac></mfenced></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="5 cos open parentheses 6 over 5 close parentheses"><mn>5</mn><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mn>6</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac></mfenced></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
